info.title: BC Route Planner REST API
info.description:
Finds shortest/fastest route between a start point and one or more stop points on British Columbia's public road network. The BC Route planner [webpage](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content?id=9D99E684CCD042CD88FADC51E079B4B5) provides additional information. Here are some geocoded addresses to play with:
18 Douglas St,Victoria -123.36962,48.40892
1002 Johnson St, Victoria -123.355745,48.426206
543 Johnson St, Victoria, BC -123.36907,48.42770
14 Centennial Sq, Victoria, BC -123.36564,48.42863
1105 Royal Ave,New Westminster -122.92009,49.20063
808 Jackson Cres, New Westminster -122.90762,49.22558
10810 McDonald Rd, Chilliwack -121.93808,49.19859
3950 June Springs Rd, Kelowna -119.40751,49.83960
1201 Riondel Rd, Kootenay Bay -116.85402,49.74448
1201 Riondel Rd, Kootenay Bay -116.832759,49.730500 (parcelPoint)
2499 Walbran Pl, Courtenay -124.97295,49.71518
2013 Smoke Bluff Rd, Squamish -123.13946,49.70401
235 Kelvin Grove Way, Lions Bay -123.23524,49.45035
Please see our data collection notice. Please note that you may experience issues when submitting requests to the delivery or test environment if using this [OpenAPI specification](https://github.com/bcgov/api-specs) in other API console viewers. [Developer API keys](https://github.com/bcgov/gwa/wiki/Developer-Guide#developer-api-keys) are unique and provide the ability to make up to 2 requests per second. Production government applications may use organization API keys which are further described in [the Developer guide](https://github.com/bcgov/gwa/wiki/Developer-Guide#developer-api-keys).

get.summary: Get distance and travel time between two geographic points
get.description: Represents the distance and time of the shortest or fastest path between given start and end points.

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Format of representation

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: A list of any number of route points in start to end order. See points

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Routing criteria to optimize (e.g., shortest, fastest). Default is shortest.

parameters.name: distanceUnit
parameters.description: distance unit of measure (e.g., km, mi). Default is km.

parameters.name: routeDescription
parameters.description: Route description (e.g., Shortest route from 1002 Johnson St, Victoria to 1105 Royal Ave,New Westminster)

200.description: Distance and time of the shortest or fastest route

post.summary: Get distance and travel time between two geographic points
post.description: Represents the distance and time of the shortest or fastest path between given start and end points.

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Format of representation

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: A list of any number of route points in start to end order. See points

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Routing criteria to optimize (e.g., shortest, fastest). Default is shortest.

parameters.name: distanceUnit
parameters.description: distance unit of measure (e.g., km, mi). Default is km.

parameters.name: routeDescription
parameters.description: Route description (e.g., Shortest route from 1002 Johnson St, Victoria to 1105 Royal Ave,New Westminster)

200.description: Distance and time of the shortest or fastest route

get.summary: Get distance and travel time between each pair of geographic points
get.description: Represents the distance and time of the shortest or fastest paths between all pairs of fromPoints and toPoints. The number of fromPoints times the number of toPoints should not exceed 100 or the request will time out.

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Format of representation

parameters.name: fromPoints
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of origin points. See fromPoints

parameters.name: toPoints
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of destination points. See toPoints

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Routing criteria to optimize (e.g., shortest, fastest). Default is shortest.

parameters.name: distanceUnit
parameters.description: distance unit of measure (e.g., km, mi). Default is km.

parameters.name: routeDescription
parameters.description: Route description (e.g., Shortest route from 1002 Johnson St, Victoria to 1105 Royal Ave,New Westminster)

parameters.name: maxPairs
parameters.description: The maximum number of pairs to return for each toPoint.  Pairs are ordered by distance/time from fromPoint. For example, given 1 fromPoint, and 10 toPoints, and maxPairs=1 , return the nearest toPoint to the fromPoint. Given 3 fromPoints and 10 toPoints, maxPairs=3 means return the 3 nearest toPoints to each fromPoint.

200.description: A list of routes and their route distances/times.

post.summary: Get distance and travel time between each pair of geographic points
post.description: Represents the distance and time of the shortest or fastest paths between all pairs of fromPoints and toPoints. The number of fromPoints times the number of toPoints should not exceed 100 or the request will time out.

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Format of representation

parameters.name: fromPoints
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of origin points. See fromPoints

parameters.name: toPoints
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of destination points. See toPoints

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Routing criteria to optimize (e.g., shortest, fastest). Default is shortest.

parameters.name: distanceUnit
parameters.description: distance unit of measure (e.g., km, mi). Default is km.

parameters.name: routeDescription
parameters.description: Route description (e.g., Shortest route from 1002 Johnson St, Victoria to 1105 Royal Ave,New Westminster)

parameters.name: maxPairs
parameters.description: The maximum number of pairs to return for each toPoint.  Pairs are ordered by distance/time from fromPoint. For example, given 1 fromPoint, and 10 toPoints, and maxPairs=1 , return the nearest toPoint to the fromPoint. Given 3 fromPoints and 10 toPoints, maxPairs=3 means return the 3 nearest toPoints to each fromPoint.

200.description: A list of routes and their route distances/times.

get.summary: Get the path, distance and travel time between a series of geographic points
get.description: Represents the geometry, distance, and time of the shortest or fastest path between given start and end points.

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Format of representation

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: A list of any number of route points in start to end order. See points

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Routing criteria to optimize (e.g., shortest, fastest). Default is shortest.

parameters.name: distanceUnit
parameters.description: distance unit of measure (e.g., km, mi). Default is km.

parameters.name: roundTrip
parameters.description: If true, route ends at start point. Default is false.

parameters.name: routeDescription
parameters.description: Route description (e.g., Shortest route from 1002 Johnson St, Victoria to 1105 Royal Ave,New Westminster)

200.description: Geometry, distance, and time of the shortest or fastest route

post.summary: Get the path, distance and travel time between a series of geographic points
post.description: Represents the geometry, distance, and time of the shortest or fastest path between given start and end points.

parameters.description: A list of any number of route points in start to end order. See points

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Routing criteria to optimize (e.g., shortest, fastest). Default is shortest.

parameters.name: distanceUnit
parameters.description: distance unit of measure (e.g., km, mi). Default is km.

parameters.name: roundTrip
parameters.description: If true, route ends at start point. Default is false.

parameters.name: routeDescription
parameters.description: Route description (e.g., Shortest route from 1002 Johnson St, Victoria to 1105 Royal Ave,New Westminster)

200.description: Geometry, distance, and time of the shortest or fastest route

parameters.name: routeDescription

get.summary: Get the optimal path, distance and travel time between a start point and a series of end points which are reordered to minimize total distance or time.
get.description: Represents the geometry, distance, and time of the shortest or fastest path between a start point and a series of end points which are reordered to minimize distance or time

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Format of representation

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: A list of any number of route points in start to end order. See points

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Routing criteria to optimize (e.g., shortest, fastest). Default is shortest.

parameters.name: distanceUnit
parameters.description: distance unit of measure (e.g., km, mi). Default is km.

parameters.name: roundTrip
parameters.description: If true, route ends at start point. Default is false.

parameters.name: routeDescription
parameters.description: Route description (e.g., Shortest route from 1002 Johnson St, Victoria to 1105 Royal Ave,New Westminster)

200.description: Geometry, distance, and time of the shortest or fastest route. End points are reordered to minimize total distance or time

post.summary: Get the path, distance and travel time between a start point and a series of end points which are reordered to minimize total distance or time.

parameters.name: criteria

parameters.name: distanceUnit

get.summary: Get the directions, optimal path, distance and travel time between a start point and a series of end points which are reordered to minimize total distance or time.

parameters.name: roundTrip
parameters.description: If true, route ends at start point. Default is false.

parameters.name: routeDescription
parameters.description: Route description (e.g., Shortest route from 1002 Johnson St, Victoria to 1105 Royal Ave,New Westminster)

200.description: turn-by-turn directions, geometry, distance, and time of the shortest or fastest route. End points are reordered to minimize total distance or time.

post.summary: Get the directions, optimal path, distance and travel time between a start point and one or more end points which are reordered to minimize total distance or time.
post.description: Represents the turn-by-turn directions, geometry, distance, and time of the shortest path or fastest path between a start point and one or more end points which are reordered to minimize distance or time.

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Format of representation

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: A list of any number of route points in start to end order. See points

parameters.name: outputSRS

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Routing criteria to optimize (e.g., shortest, fastest). Default is shortest.

parameters.name: distanceUnit
parameters.description: distance unit of measure (e.g., km, mi). Default is km.

parameters.name: roundTrip
parameters.description: If true, route ends at start point. Default is false.

parameters.name: routeDescription
parameters.description: Route description (e.g., Shortest route from 1002 Johnson St, Victoria to 1105 Royal Ave,New Westminster)

200.description: turn-by-turn directions, geometry, distance, and time of the shortest or fastest route. End points are reordered to minimize total distance or time.
